intro: Athanasia tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, fragrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Athanasia tridens is often grown as a decorative plant in gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
